result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Codi L Mayo

defendant.name: Mayo, Codi L
defendant.address: 1911 Rusty Lane, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt: 10:06 AM Defendant Codi L Mayo appeared by video.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits NOT waived. Notice of right to attorney given to Defendant. Court explains the SPD process. Defendant will change her mind and WAIVES the time limits for the Preliminary hearing. Bond already set and is to continue. Defendant questions the court on postponing this matter. DA Kelz makes comments. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

11:48:03 AM * DAR* DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Codi Mayo appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for The State of Wisconsin. Defendant's next court date is 09/13/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives Defendant a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. No objections from the defendant. Bond ordered as requested. 11:48:51 *DAR*
